alert.note: Alert for Virginia Beach (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued August 30 at 3:50PM EDT until August 31 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT NOW IN EFFECT THROUGH THURSDAY EVENING... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM THURSDAY TO NOON EDT FRIDAY... ...COASTAL FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH LATE FRIDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...For the Beach Hazards Statement, dangerous rip currents and large battering waves expected. For the High Surf Advisory, large breaking waves of 7 to 10 feet expected in the surf zone. For the Coastal Flood Watch, up to 2 feet of inundation above ground level possible in low-lying areas near shorelines and tidal waterways. * WHERE...Virginia Beach. * WHEN...For the Beach Hazards Statement, through Thursday evening. For the High Surf Advisory, from 10 AM Thursday to noon EDT Friday. For the Coastal Flood Watch, from Thursday afternoon through late Friday night. * IMPACTS...Numerous roads may be closed. Low lying property including homes, businesses, and some critical infrastructure may be inundated. Shore and dune erosion is possible. Dangerous swimming and surfing conditions and localized beach erosion. Do not enter or approach the water due to the risk of being swept away. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. SEWELLS POINT VA MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 4.5 FT, MODERATE 5.5 FT, MAJOR 6.5 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 1.7 FT, MODERATE 2.7 FT, MAJOR 3.7 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 30/09 PM 4.2 1.4 0.9 1 NONE 31/10 AM 5.2 2.4 2.1 3-4 MINOR 31/10 PM 5.5 2.7 2.2 4 MODERATE 01/11 AM 5.0 2.2 1.7 3-4 MINOR 01/11 PM 4.5 1.7 1.3 2 MINOR 02/11 AM 4.3 1.5 1.1 2 NONE CHESAPEAKE BAY BRIDGE TUNNEL VA MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 5.0 FT, MODERATE 5.5 FT, MAJOR 6.0 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 2.1 FT, MODERATE 2.6 FT, MAJOR 3.1 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 30/09 PM 4.2 1.3 0.6 2 NONE 31/09 AM 5.2 2.3 1.8 4-5 MINOR 31/09 PM 5.4 2.5 1.9 6 MINOR 01/10 AM 5.0 2.1 1.4 5-6 MINOR 01/10 PM 4.5 1.6 1.1 4 NONE 02/11 AM 4.3 1.4 0.7 2-3 NONE LYNNHAVEN INLET VA MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 4.5 FT, MODERATE 5.0 FT, MAJOR 5.5 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 1.8 FT, MODERATE 2.3 FT, MAJOR 2.8 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 30/09 PM 4.1 1.4 1.0 1 NONE 31/10 AM 4.9 2.2 2.0 1 MINOR 31/10 PM 5.1 2.4 2.0 1 MODERATE 01/10 AM 4.7 2.0 1.7 1 MINOR 01/11 PM 4.2 1.5 1.2 1 NONE 02/11 AM 4.1 1.4 1.0 1 NONE &&
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. Inexperienced swimmers should remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions. Life-threatening rip currents. If caught in a rip current, remain calm. Swim in a direction following the shoreline. If tired, float or tread water until out of the rip current. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help.
